Rosalina dreams of having a happy and peaceful life and hopes that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies like glass, stainless steel materials, silicon and other materials used in the business

loans.name: Melchie

texts.en:
Melchie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Melchie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Melchie has been in this business for seven years now. The photo shows Melchie together with her child.

In the future, Melchie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 59 years old and widowed with eight children. 

She has a hog fattening business as a source of income and to help towards looking after her children’s expenses. 

She focuses on her business in order to achieve a higher income. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vitamins. 

She hopes to earn a higher income this time for the financial security of her business and family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 47 and resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gaspar, a garbage collector and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilia operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, ranging from round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats, but also offers other crafts that most rug-makers come across every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabrics, threads and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilia dreams of expanding her business further and hopes that her business will grow even more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabrics, cloth, threads and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is a 28-year-old woman from Ubay, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than ten years now. 

Adeline is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. 

Adeline hopes of expanding her business in the future and making it sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is married with seven children. Six of her children are working whilst her youngest child goes to school. 

Clarita has managed a home-based store for 20 years. The profits gained from her business go towards their daily necessities, children's allowances and monthly electric bills.

Clarita wishes to have a stable source of income, so she could let her youngest child finish her studies and have comfortable living conditions. 

To realize all these things, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 7,000 to allow her to buy stocks of groceries, such as soft drinks, eggs, onions, garlic and sugar for her home-based store. 

She knows that the loan amount she has requested will really be a big help in making her business productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries, such as soft drinks, eggs, onions, garlic and sugar for her home-based store

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is married and is the mother of four children. 

She is 25 years of age and is a very industrious hog-raiser. She has been involved in raising pigs for over four years. She earns an income of PHP 10,000 from previous sales and uses this to improve their living situation. 

She wants to achieve a higher income to save for the education of her children. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vitamins. 

She just hopes to be able to improve her hogs to achieve an enhanced profit and also lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. She previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase the scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She is a widow and she continues to work to provide an income for her daily needs and to be able to help her children.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lilia dreams of having her own place for her junk shop and hopes to have good health always. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les 10  femmes du groupe Mougnou  ont  en moyenne 41ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de Tominian    dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de poissons, condiments et la vente de divers articles. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  intègrent  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, TENIN  (1 ère personne debout  de la gauche  vers la droite) est très connue dans son activité  de vente de poissons fumés et frais  de tous dans la ville.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 cartons de fumés et 5 cartons de poissons frais. Elle s’approvisionne  auprès des grossistes à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à domicile,  à la foire les Samedis et  dans les grandes foires environnants. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame TENIN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in extended, traditional families, the 10 women of the Mougnou group have an average age of 41 and, on average, 6 children. They all live in the town of Tominian in the Ségou region (4th administrative district of Mali) and got to know each other through neighbourly and family relationships, and marriage. They are small resellers of fish, condiments and various other items. The members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their first group loan.

Tenin (the first person standing on the left in the picture) is well known by everyone in town for the smoked and fresh fish that she sells. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 boxes of smoked fish and 5 boxes of fresh fish. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in San. She makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door, at the Saturday market and at the large market fairs in the surrounding area, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Tenin hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Marichu works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marichu is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Marichu has been sustaining her business activities with her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and  to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les femmes du groupe SOUTOURA ont  en moyenne 38  ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de TOMINIAN dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat la restauration et la vente de condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe soutoura ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 8 e prêt solidaire
Madame, NIANA  femme debout au milieu compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de riz décortiqué, 2 sacs d’oignon frais de 50 kg, un seau de 25 kg de pâte d’arachide, 2 cartons de Maggi et une grande quantité d’épices. Elle  effectue ses ventes   au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle composée de   femmes et d’hommes  à la foire de TOMINIAN et les jours ordinaires et  à domicile.
Avec ce prêt, Madame NIANA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in extended, traditional families, the women of the Soutoura group have an average age of 38 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in the town of Tominian in the Ségou region (4th administrative district of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships. They buy and sell condiments and prepare food. The members of the Soutoura group joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business and are on their 8th group loan.

Niana (the person standing in the middle of the back row the picture) plans to use her loan to buy 3 boxes of dehusked rice, 2 bags (50kgs) of fresh onions, a 25kg-pail of peanut butter, 2 boxes of Maggi stock cubes and a large quantity of spices. She makes her sales for cash or credit, at the Tominian market fair and door-to-door on non-market days, to a retail clientèle made up of women and men. Thanks to this loan, Niana hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 40 years old and married with four children.

Marlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs an ambulant produce business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of onion, garlic, carrots, etc. to sell.

Marlene has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.
Marlene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of onion, garlic, carrots, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
This is Pedro. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy all the needed products for his variety store which gave him an increased income. He has had this business for five years now. He is single and he works hard to provide income for his everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan that he will be utilizing to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add into his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Pedro hopes to have strength and good health to continue his responsibilities. He dreams that his business will continue to grow. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for his store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 57-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol.  She has engaged in hog raising and rice farming for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income. Aida is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising and rice farming ventures thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Aida dreams of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and fertlizer for the farm.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda is engaged in hog-raising in the village of Centro 2. She is 30 years old and is married. They are blessed with three children. Esmeralda works hard to support their daily needs and to help her children financially. She wants to develop her business and increase her income. To this end, Esmeralda wants to borrow PHP 40,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can develop her business and purchase more hogs to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Lee Marvin

texts.en: Lee Marvin is 26 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. He aims to become financially stable to give his family a better life. Farming is the main source of their living, but due to insufficient income, Lee Marvin runs a small variety store in the village to generate additional income. He plans to increase his product offerings to satisfy his customers' demand but due to inadequate capital needs a loan to do so.  He is asking for an additional PHP 18,000 to buy more stock of shampoos, soaps, soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell. He believes that this loan will make it possible to improve the business and hopes that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shampoos, soaps, soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is 36 years of age, a hardworking and loving mother. She has been engaged in the caring of pigs since she was married to Renie. This is her way of making an income for her family. She carefully takes care of her business to gain higher profits. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 32 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rio buys and sells bananas in the Philippines. Rio requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.
Rio has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rio would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia runs a beauty salon in the town of Angadanan and requested a PHP 15,000 loan to buy beauty products such as make-up kits, dyes, medicines for re-bonding and hot oil for her beauty salon. She has been in this business for more than two years and is thankful for the improvement of her living conditions. She believes that the financial assistance will help her business. In the future she will be successful, as she continues to work hard.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as make-up kits, dyes, medicines for re-bonding and hot oil for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Simplecia

texts.en:
Simplecia works hard to support her family. Simplecia is married buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines.

Simplecia requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.
Simplecia has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Simplecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Superiana

texts.en:
Superiana is married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Superiana is 58 years old and has one child who is in school.

Superiana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Superiana requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.
Superiana has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Superiana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is a 59-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has 3 grown children. She engages in a retail business. She sells products like lotion, perfume, talc powder and body spray. Aside from this retail business she also operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells beverages, canned goods, sugar and soaps. She has been in the retail business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional items such as soft drinks, noodles, milk, coffee and condiments. In the future, Teofila would like to expand her business as well as to save the old age.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as soft drinks, noodles, milk, coffee and condiments for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 54, and a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Bernardino. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elizabeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products as well as the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 5000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30, 000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elizabeth dreams to have her own stall for all her products and hopes to give a good life to her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 24-year-old married woman and has three young children. They live in Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. She has engaged in rice farming together with her husband for more than 2 years now. This has been the source of their income.
Aida wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She joined CEVI to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization to the micro entrepreneurs like her. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their crops and eventually their harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 25 years old with four children. She manages a hog raising business to generate income. She has operated this business for four years and usually earns a profit of PHP 8,000, which is usually spent for their daily necessities such as food and allowances. She wants to buy 2 more hogs and feed but due to insufficient funds she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy 2 hogs and feed. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the business and make their living conditions better.

loans.use: to buy 2 more hogs and feed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 46 years old and is engaged in a hog-fattening business as a source of livelihood. With this occupation, she provides for her family’s needs and wants. For the 5 years she has been working in this business, Maribel has worked patiently due to her love for her family. Right now, to satisfy also the needs of her hogs, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine. She is looking after her hogs so well because they will provide her with a high income after 5 or 6 months. Hopefully, with her unending hard work she will achieve her dream of higher profits.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine for her hogs.

loans.name: Maria Charito

texts.en: Maria Charito is a hard working mother who owns and manages a variety store in her local community. She is 49 years of age and has three school-age children. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a bright future. For this reason, Maria Charito planned to improve her variety store to generate a higher income to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of her children. To improve the business, she is asking for an additional of PHP 14,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, soaps, shampoos, noodles, canned goods, beverages, snack foods and seasonings to sell. She believes that someday, she will make the business profitable as she continues to work and strive toward reaching her goals.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, soaps, shampoos, noodles, canned goods, beverages, snack foods and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. Vicenta is married and buys and sells dried and fermented fish in the Philippines.

Vicenta requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.
Vicenta has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried and fermented fish to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha wants to improve her business to make it a practical source of income. To do it, she is asking for additional capital of 7,000 PHP to buy feeds and medicines to nourish her pigs. 

She hopes that her requested loan will be approved. This will be a great help to her to improve the business and their poor living as well.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines.

loans.name: Dioning

texts.en:
Dioning is a married woman and a mother of four children from Jagna, Bohol, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in vegetable gardening for more than 16 years now. This is the source of her income. Dioning gives her best to help her husband in supporting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children. 

She is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, pesticides and nylon. With this she will be able to improve her vegetable garden, thus increasing her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertlizer, pesticides and nylon.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is a hog-raiser. He has been in this kind of business for almost one year. He is 21 years old, and is single. 

Eduard wants to have more hogs to raise, but he lacks the necessary capital. To make it possible, Eduard is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise. 

He believes that through his loan he will be able to sustain the proper growth of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
In Samnak Tboung village of Prey Chor district, Khim and his spouse live and operate a farm to support their family, which is composed of five children. 

He grows rice twice a year because he has a good business location where there is enough water even in dry season. At the age of 56, he is able to generate income of approximately KHR 10,000 per day. Khim has been working as a cultivator for more than 30 years. Khim and some of his children are also engaged in a recycling business besides farming. 

This will be his fourth loan cycle with HKL, and Khim is taking out a KHR 4,500,000 loan to use for buying and selling recycled materials. The loan will allow them to buy more recycled materials and gain more profit. In the future, Khim wants to go a long way in his business and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy and sell recycled materials.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn dreams her business will get bigger and hopes to have a happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Orly

texts.en:
Orly is a hog-raiser. He has been in this kind of business for five years. He is now 44 years old, and he is married and has four children. 

Orly wants to have more hogs to raise, but he lacks the necessary capital. To make it possible, Orly is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise. 

He believes that through his loan he will be able to sustain the proper growth of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
This is Charita, 43, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Zaldy and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Charita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHO 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarge her business. 

Susan dreams to give her children a good education and life. She hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 50 years of age, married and has two children. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he engages in raising hogs to generate additional income. He aims to make the business profitable in order to generate sufficient income. 

He plans to raise more pigs to sell but he has not enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for PHP 36,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. 

He believes that this loan will be a great help for him to improve the business and hopes that he will become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new loan of 35,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rowena hopes to be successful in life and business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of ten children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 15 years. Her husband works as a farmer.
 
Fermina is asking for a loan to buy feeds and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve the growth the health of her pigs.

In the future, Fermina hopes to make her business successful and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feeds and food supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Alexi Jeobani

texts.es: Alexi  tiene 40 años de edad, tiene una hija, vive en  una colonia que pertenece al municipio de  Choloma, Cortes junto a su esposa e hija. El estuvo trabajando en una empresa privada y al no tener empleo decidió por poner su propio negocio. Hace 6 meses se dedica a vender golosinas como churros, refrescos, dulces, frutas, galletas y otros. El tiene pensado vender comidas  y tarjetas de saldo de celulares también, y para eso esta solicitando un préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para comprar una estufa industrial para la elaboración de comidas y surtir de golosinas,recargas y tarjetas para celulares. Su objetivo es obtener mas ingresos y que su negocio vaya creciendo hasta convertirla en pulpería grande.
texts.en:
Alexi is 40 years old, and he has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and daughter in a neighborhood in the Choloma municipality in Cortes.  He was working for a private company, but when he no longer had employment he decided to set up his own business.  He has been selling sweets like churros, soft drinks, candy, fruit, cookies, and others for six months.

He is thinking of selling food and cell phone charge cards too.  In order to do so he is requesting 6,000 lempiras to buy an industrial stove in order to make food and to stock up on sweets, rechargeable phone cards, and calling cards for mobile phones.

His objective is to have more income and for his business to keep growing until it becomes a large grocery store.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove in order to make food and to stock up on sweets, rechargeable phone cards, and calling cards for mobile phones.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
This is Anecita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase a great number and variety of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her business. Her earnings helped her to pay her personal, household, and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for a 9,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. Additional items to sell will result in more profit. Her profit from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial improvement with a glad and thankful heart.

Anecita hopes that her business will expand and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. With them, she also draws strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Blanca Noemy

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, vive en una aldea del municipio de Villanueva, Cortes junto a su esposo e hijo. Ella estableció su propio negocio hace 3 años, de donde obtiene los ingresos para su hogar. Vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, sal, manteca, harina, huevos, churros, refrescos, productos de aseo, productos enlatados, pastas, etc.  Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 28,000 lempiras para surtir de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, harina, azúcar, churros, refrescos, etc. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar las ventas y las ganancias, ya que se ha visto mayor demanda de clientes.  Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio para poder darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 37, is married and has a child.  She lives with her husband and child in the Villanueva municipality in Cortes.  Three years ago she established her own business from which she gets income for her household.

She sells basic needs products like rice, beans, sugar, coffee, salt, shortening, flour, eggs, churros, soft drinks, personal care products, canned goods, and pastas, etc.

She has decided to request a loan for 28,000 lempiras to stock up on food products like basic grains, flour, sugar, churros, and soft drinks, etc.  This investment will help her to increase sales and her income.  This is because she has seen greater customer demand.  

Her plan is to make her business grow in order be able to give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock her grocery business and increase sales.

loans.name: Candida Dominga

texts.es:
Cándida, 47 años de edad, originaria de León, madre de tres hijos de 25,22 y 20 años de edad respectivamente, se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Negocio que inicio ayudando a vender a su hermana, ella tenía 17 años de edad. Actualmente sobrevive  con la venta de mariscos en su humilde tramo el cual abre desde muy tempranas horas para recibir a sus clientes en busca de pescado fresco, camarones, conchas de cangrejo que son parte de las variedades de mariscos que vende. 
Está solicitando el crédito para comprar pescado, cangrejos, conchas, camerones. Ya que entre mayor producto venda mejores serán los ingresos que espera recibir. Pues desea ampliar y mejorar la infraestructura de su local y ofrecer mariscos de calidad.
texts.en:
Cándida is forty-seven years old and is a native of León.  She is a mother of three children, ages 25, 22, and 20.  She makes a living in selling seafood, a business that she got involved with at age seventeen by helping her sister make sales.  

Today, she survives by selling seafood in her humble locale, which she opens in the very early hours in order to receive customers who are in search of fresh fish, shrimp, shellfish, and crabs, which are some of the various types of seafood that she sells.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fish, crabs, shellfish, and shrimp.  With more and better products, she will be able to receive a greater income.  

She hopes to grow and improve the infrastructure of her neighborhood and to offer high-quality seafood.

loans.use: to buy fish, crabs, shellfish, and shrimp.

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Nut is 66 years old and lives with her husband and children in a thatched house in Slaeng village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Her house is not too far from a public gathering place. Nut’s family traditional business is agriculture. She looks old but she is strong enough to cultivate rice and raise hogs seasonally. Through her effort and hardships, Nut, with the help of her husband and children, is able to make in the neighborhood of 15,000 KHR each day to cover her daily costs. Nut has been a farmer for not less than 30 years.

Nut needs to change her thatched wall because it is very old and beginning to decay. That’s why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR to purchase a new thatched wall and make some home renovations. She hopes to protect her family from bad weather and provide them a proper shelter to live in. She appreciates the support from lenders and she promises to pay the loan back honestly as she has been with HKL for four loan cycles and has successfully paid off all of her loans.

loans.use: to purchase a new thatched wall and make some home renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken legs, sausages, and 'lamb flaps'.

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es: Adonay, tiene 32 años de edad, casado, tiene una hija, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Anteriormente Adonay  generaba sus ingresos realizando fletes en carreta de caballo. Hace dos años decidió por establecer  una pequeña pulpería donde vende arroz, manteca, jabón, churros, dulces, pan, harina, condimentos y otros porductos basicos. El ha decidido obtener un préstamo por 3,000 lempiras para comprar más productos alimenticios para vender e ir aumentando poco a poco el inventario y crecer económicamente. Su sueño es llegar a tener su negocio fuerte y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Se siente contento por el apoyo financiero brindado.
texts.en:
Adonay, age 32, is married and has a daughter.  He lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  Adonay previously generated income by making deliveries in a horse-drawn wagon.

Two years ago he decided to establish a small grocery store where he sells rice, shortening, soap, churros, candy, bread, condiments, and other basic products.

He has decided to get a loan for 3,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy more food products to sell, to increase his inventory little by little, and to grow financially.

His dream is to come to have a strong business and to be able to improve his family’s quality of life.  He is happy about the financial support that has been provided.

loans.use: to stock the business with food products.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie manages a fishpond, hog raising, corn farm and retail store. She has run her fish pond, corn farm and hog raising since 1990 while her retail store is still just three years in operation. Lenie lives with her husband and four children.

Lenie aims to have a progressive and profitable business someday.With her determination to attain it, she endures all trials in order to become a successful entreprenuer someday. Lenie's fish pond, corn farm and hog raising are already stable, but now she struggles with a shortage of capital for her retail store due to some in her neighborhood paying on credit.

For this reason, she is seeking additional capital amounting to PHP 15,000.This amount will be used in buying  groceries such as cooking ingredients,cases of soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, frozen foods and raw meat such as chicken and pork for her retail store. She knows that completeness of her merchandise will help her in attaining her goals in life. In addition, she could also earn higher income and supply all her customers' needs. In this situation, she could obtain better income which will enable her to support her children's education and secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as cooking ingredients,cases of soft drinks,  snack foods, biscuits, frozen foods and raw meat such as chicken and pork for her retail store

loans.name: Malua

texts.en: Malua is a 55-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing cabbages and cucumbers to earn a living. Malua has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Malua will spend her profits to extend her business in the future and to save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, fertilizers and shovels.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 29 years old and single with no children. She plans to start a business selling Elei (fabric printing) and printing. She has requested a loan to provide her with materials and equipment for her business. Elena will use her profits to improve and bring the best quality into her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a design board, paint brush and material.

loans.name: Taupou

texts.en:
Taupou is a 23-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing different kinds of vegetables to earn a living. Taupou has requested a loan to buy seeds and equipment to start her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Taupou will spend her profits to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, fertilizers and shovels.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe Yeredon  ont  en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Tominian dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments et de céréales. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus croissantes  et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  3e prêt solidaire.
Madame KANOU  (debout au milieu  en complet wax sur la photo) excelle dans la vente de condiments de tous genres. Elle est très sollicitée dans la  ville de Tominian et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10  bidons de vingt litres d huile  deux douzaines de Maggi un carton de poivre 3 cartons de pâte de tomate et 4 sacs de sel. Elle s’approvisionne à la frontière MALI Burkina plus précisément à Benena, mensuellement. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes au grand marché de Tominian. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame KANOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of the five women of the Yeredon group are married and live in large traditional families. The average age for the group is 36 years old, and the women have, on average, four children each. They all live in the town of Tominian, in the Ségou region (fourth-largest administrative region in Mali). They met one another through neighborly, professional, and family ties. They buy and sell condiments and grains.

The group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's credit program in the hope of meeting the high demand of their ever-growing customer base. They are on their third group loan.

KANOU (in the photo, she is the woman standing in the middle, wearing a full wax) excels in the sale of condiments of all sorts. She is in very high demand in the town of Tominian and its surroundings.

She plans to use her loan to buy 10 20L-contianers of oil, two dozen Maggis, 1 box of pepper, 3 boxes of tomato paste, and 4 bags of salt. She stocks up each month at the border between Mali and Burkina Faso, specifically in Benena. She sells her goods individually, for cash, to a mixed clientele at the big market in Tominian.

With the loan, KANOU hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her business and use to help her spouse support their family.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Lolini

texts.en: Lolini  is 20 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small store. She has been doing this for two years. Lolini needs a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, sugar, and coffee. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snacks, sugar, salt, and coffee

loans.name: Efrina

texts.en:
Efrina is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. They live in Duero, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a vegetable gardening business for more than ten years now. Efrina is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her vegetable farm and her harvest.

In the future, Efrina has hopes of making her venture a success and profitable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 39 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells elei (printed material and fabric) to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Elena has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, brushes, rollers and stencils. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's financial needs. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy design board, fabric paint, fabric material and brushes.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 37-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a business selling food items and household items in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Marie has requested a loan to buy everything she needs in her store. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and save some for her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, a sack of flour, snacks, soft drinks, beer and shoes for her store.

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en: Sifaga is 42 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling snacks, drinks, frozen items, cups and plates in her community and has been doing this for three years. Sifaga has requested a loan to restock her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sifaga will help with her family's financial needs .

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, a new freezer and snacks.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 19 años de edad,  vive a lado de su joven esposa y juntos tiene un pequeño de 4 meses de edad, por quien sonríe cada vez que lo ve y a pesar de ser tan joven trabaja con muchas fuerzas para poder brindarle una vida digna y sobre todo llena de amor; la ciudad donde viven es la ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima variado así como también playas hermosas y una gastronomía muy variada, Desde pequeño Mario aprendió a trabajar ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tenía la necesidad de apoyarlos, por ello solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de odontología.

Día a día Mario trabaja  como obrero en una empresa textil, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo, el  cree que está  saliendo adelante en su  trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Mario está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento,arena,fierros, entre otros; para poder realizar refacciones de paredes y el techo de su vivienda, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su cliente y podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener su vivienda construida de material  noble”.
texts.en:
Mario is a 19-year old man who lives with her young wife and their 4-month old son, for whom he smiles every time he sees him. Despite his young age, he works very hard to provide him with a decent and, above all, full of love life. They live in the city of Chincha, which has a varied weather, beautiful beaches and a broad gastronomy. Mario learned to work when he was a little boy as his parents had limited financial resources and needed his support. This is why he only studied until 5th grade in middle school although he would have liked to study a degree in Dentistry. 

Mario is a workman in a textile company and works for approximately 9 hours each day. Thanks to his hard work, he can cover his household expenses and believes he's getting ahead because he is responsible and enthusiastic. 

Mario feels very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he'll be able to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand and metal, among others, to repair the walls and ceiling of his house. This way he'll be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and to continue fighting every day to make his biggest dream come true: having his house built in fine material.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Wendy Denise

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven de 27 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha la cual se caracteriza por la alegría de sus pobladores, así como también por su gastronómica y sus playas hermosas. Wendy es una joven que día a día lucha para poder brindarle a su familia una vida mejor a pesar de las adversidades, Wendy es madre de una pequeña de 2 años de edad, a quien quiere muchísimo y quienes su el regalo más grande que Dios le ha podido dar. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho es tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Wendy se levanta muy temprano para ir a su trabajo, ella es obrera en una pequeña empresa agrícola de su ciudad en la cual labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, ella cree que esta saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honrada.

Wendy esta agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, ladrillos, entre otros, de esta manera podrá terminar de construir un pequeño cuarto, con el cual podrá tener un espacio adecuado para que habite su hijo y así darle una mejor calidad de vida y con ello seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y brindarle una buena educación a su hija”.
texts.en:
Wendy, 27, lives in the city of Chincha, which is known for its happy residents, great food, and beautiful beaches. Despite adversity, Wendy works hard every day to improve her family's circumstances. She is the mother of a two-year-old daughter, whom she loves very much and considers her greatest gift from God. Wendy was only able to complete fifth grade due to financial constraints, but she would have liked to have gone to college. 

Wendy rises early each morning to go to her job; she works about nine hours a day for a small agricultural firm in the city. She believes that she is getting ahead because she is very responsible and, most of all, honest.

Wendy thanks the Kiva lenders, whose help will let her buy construction materials like cement, sand, bricks, and more so that she can finish building a small room. The room is for her child, and the extra space will improve their situation. Wendy will keep striving to achieve her great dreams: to finish building her house and to provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  DANAYA ont en moyenne  32 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à San, cercle de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de calebasses, d’habillements etc. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés les   prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 13eme  prêt solidaire
KADIA FOUNE (1ere personne debout de la gauche sur la photo) compte utilise son prêt pour acheter, 50 pièces de bazin. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO  auprès des grossistes pour venir revendre à SAN  à domicile et au marché  au  comptant, en détail  en espèce et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt, dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya live in extended traditional families in San, in the circle of SAN, region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali). They average 32 years of age and two children each, and they know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They work in small trade, buying and selling various merchandise such as calebasses (large bowls made from dried gourds), clothing, etc. This is their 13th group loan, and all past loans were repaid without incident. 

KADIA FOUNE (first standing from the left) plans to use her loan to buy 50 pieces of bazin. She buys her stock from Bamako wholesalers, and she conducts her sales at retail from her home and at the market in San, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan and to cover expenses relating to healthcare, food and tuition. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy bazins for resale.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Joven Hugo tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive con su abuelo en la ciudad de Carapeguá, en una pequeña compañía. Desde muy joven comenzó a salir a vender las colchas que se producen en la zona,  lleva  productos artesanales  a venderlos por las ciudades de Fernando de la  Mora y Posadas -  Argentina,  y tiene como móvil un automóvil que gracias  a este trabajo logró comprarse y también brindarle a su abuelo la ayuda que necesita, ya que él es su sustento. Hugo es una persona muy trabajadora, y que desea seguir trabajando para poder crecer.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y quiere poder seguir cumpliendo con su clientela, y así crecer y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Young Hugo is 22, single, and lives with his grandfather in the city of Carapeguá, in a small society.  Since he was very young, he started going out to sell the quilts that are produced in the area. He carries craft products to the cities of Fernando de la Mora and Posadas, Argentina to sell them. 

For transportation he has a car that, thanks to this job, he was able to buy and which also allows him to offer his grandfather the help he needs, since he provides his livelihood. Hugo is a very hard-working person, and he wishes to continue working to be able to grow.  

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of hammocks, blankets and sheets since he has many orders for these products and he wants to be able to continue meeting his clientele's needs, and that way grow and continue working.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets and sheets

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de Ciudad del Este, de un pueblo Minga Guazu, el cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Ramona es una de las integrantes, tiene su pequeño negocio de puesto de ventas de empanadas  Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para sus empanadas, como ser carne, verduras y demás para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Activas (Energetic Women) is in its second loan cycle with the women's committee program. The members live in Ciudad del Este, a town in Minga Guazu, a growing area just outside the center. The area is hard to get to and growing slowly, which is one reason these women are striving to expand their businesses and provide a better environment for their community.

Ramona, one of the members, has a small stand where she sells empanadas. She hopes that, over time and with the help of other locals, she can improve her surroundings, make her family safer, and foresee a brighter future. She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients to make empanadas such as meat and vegetables so that she can keep working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and runs a jeepney operator business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney.
Evelyn has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phone minutes to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 63-year-old married woman and mother of seven grown children. She lives with her family in Jagna, Bohol. Teresita has engaged in vegetable and flower gardening for more than 30 years now. This has been the source of their income. Teresita is requesting a loan for 4000 PHP to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this she will be able to improve her farm thus increasing her harvest and allow her to sell more vegetables at the market. Teresita hopes of expanding her business so that it will generate more income and provide for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertlizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Pesi

texts.en:
Pesi is a 38-year-old, married woman, with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. 

Pesi has requested a loan to buy shovels, fertilizer, crops, a wheelbarrow, and chemicals. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2008. With her profits, Pesi hopes to develop her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovels, a wheelbarrow, crops, and chemicals for her plantation.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a una de las miembros que se motivo para ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas, El comité cuenta con trece (13) integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea, están trabajando según el proyecto de eliminación de pobreza, y su progreso está siendo medido con el semáforo de 50 indicadores de pobreza, para que las mismas puedan aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar sus vidas por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Addia es una ejemplo, ya que vende comestibles, y gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su familia, con las capacitaciones y el seguimiento de su asesora están llegando lejos ella y sus compañeras, pudiendo asi mejorar mucho.
Addia solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, huevos, carne, aceite, verduras, entre otros productos para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
This communal bank was started by one of the members, whose motivation was helping her friends and neighbors. The group comprises 13 members, all of whom have a trade or business that, small as it may be, keeps them working in accordance with a poverty reduction program. Their progress is measured by 50 poverty indicators, and the program shows them ways to increase their income and improve their standard of living through hard work and sacrifice.

Addia is one example; she sells prepared foods. Thanks to her efforts, training, and a counselor's oversight, she is helping her family. She and the other members have come far and have grown their businesses. Addida is applying for a loan to buy flour, eggs, meat, oil, vegetables, and other supplies to prepare the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, meat, oil, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.ru:
Назир с 1958 года рождения, женат и имеет двоих детей. Назир занимается  ремонтом бытовой техники , это холодильники, кондиционеры и т.д. Он начинал свою деятельность в 2005 году. У него не было отдельной мастерской и всем этим он занимался у себя дома.  На сегодняшний день у него имеется мастерская , находящейся недалеко от дома. Супруга его  нигде не работает, домохозяйка. 
Назир берет кредит для покупки запчастей и инструментов для ремонта бытовой техники.   В связи с этим он улучшает условия своего сервиса и качество услуг.   Назир выражает огромную благодарность ООО МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nazir was born in 1958, is married and has two children. Nazir has been engaged in repairing appliances: refrigerators, air conditioners, etc. He began his work in 2005. He did not have a separate workshop and he did all his work at home. Today, he has a workshop located close to home. His wife is not working; she is a homemaker. 

Nazir is taking a loan for the purchase of spare parts and tools for the repair of appliances. In this regard, he is improving his service and quality. Nazir expresses gratitude to MDO Arvand for their support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for household appliances

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai is 40 years old and married with 3 children.
She has a small plantation where she grows taros, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Faafetai needs a loan to buy weed killer, bush knives and other equipment to help her improve her plantation.
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.  Faafetai will use the profits from her sales to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives and weed killer to use on her plantation where she grows taros, bananas and yams.

loans.name: Feliuai

texts.en: Feliuai is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling a variety of snacks and soft drinks in her community and has been doing this for 5 years. Feliuai has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, pork buns, snacks, and ice cakes. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Feliuai will help with her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy snacks for her food stall.

loans.name: Luaupu

texts.en: Luaupu is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates Bingo business. She has 3 years of experience in this kind of business. Luaupu needs a loan to buy everything she needs for her business. She hopes to use her profits to pay her children’s school fees and to save more money to expand her business in the future. She joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a new bingo machine and bingo boards.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Librada está en su ciclo 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las 18  integrantes lograron superar la línea de pobreza. Mediante el esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente están conscientes de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que están haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total.
La Sra. Andresa, ella hace venta de diario, cartones de bingo, llaveros, quinielas y a la vez de acuerdo a las fechas conmemoradas como ser día de San Valentín realiza ventas de artículos de regalo.
La Sra. Andresa solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos varios para la venta como peluches, cajitas decoradas, flores, llaveros, pañuelos, Chocolates etc.  lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio
texts.en:
The group Santa Librada is on its eighth loan cycle of the Committee of Women Program, in which they all work and help each other get ahead.

They are doing a survey about eliminating poverty, according to which the 18 group members were able to overcome the poverty line.  Through effort, continuous work, and the application of the vital behavior of successful women, they find themselves improving their poverty-stricken situations, but they are equally conscious that this work and the effort that they are making has to be continuous and permanent to achieve total success.

Andresa sells newspapers, cardboard bingo boards, keychains, numbers games, as well as products corresponding to the dates in celebration, such as St. Valentine's Day, during which she sells gift items.

Andresa is requesting this loan to purchase various products to sell, such as stuffed animals, decorated boxes, flowers, keychains, handkerchiefs, chocolates, etc. which will help her to realize her business plan.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, decorated boxes, flowers, keychains, handkerchiefs, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Familia Unida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Familia Unida está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 8  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Victorina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno que es bajo. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, desea poder ir mejorando, para que el día de mañana pueda ir superando esa barrera de pobreza e ir ayudando a su familia. Ella vende todo tipo de verduras y solicita de este crédito para la compra de más variedad de verduras, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Familia Unida (United Family) is in its first loan cycle with the women's communal bank program, in which all members work and receive help to get ahead. They are part of the poverty reduction survey; eight of the members now live below the poverty line.

Victorina, one of the members, was living at level one, which is low, in the last poverty survey. Through hard work, regular employment, and behavior suited to a successful woman, she hopes to keep improving and helping her family so that one day she will overcome the poverty barrier. 

She sells all kinds of vegetables and is applying for a loan to increase her variety. This will help her firm up her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Agustina, es de la ciudad de Santaní, es dueña de una farmacia  con buena ubicación con clientela bien formada. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, se esmera cada día para poder salir adelante y de alcanzar sus objetivos, según ella empezó a trabajar en una casa farmacia como vendedora, su sueño era de tener una mini farmacia para empezar a trabajar de forma independiente. Con el correr de los tiempos con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su hijo habilito para su farmacia, ella comenta que consiguió muchísimo clientes lo que le motivo para seguir trabajando así poder hacer su sueño realidad y desde ahí amplio más su local y compro más productos farmacéuticos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de medicamentos para poder seguir surtiendo a sus clientes y dándoles mejores productos siempre.
texts.en:
Agustina, from the city of Santaní, is the owner of a pharmacy is a good location with a well-formed client base. She is a very hard-working, responsible and honest person. She strives every day to be able to get ahead and reach her goals. 

According to her, she started working in a home pharmacy as a sales person. Her dream was to have a mini pharmacy to start working independently. The passing of time, her own effort, and the help of her son enabled her to get her pharmacy. She states that she obtained many clients which motivated her to keep working this way to be able to make her dream a reality, and since then she expanded her business premises and bought more pharmaceutical products. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase medicines to be able to continue producing for her customers and giving them better products, always.

loans.use: to buy medications to sell

loans.name: Georgette Marie

texts.fr: Madame Georgette Marie  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et évolue dans le secteur de l’enseignement depuis 5 ans. Ses revenus lui permettent de gérer une partie de ses besoins personnels et d’assurer l’envoie régulier d’argent a ses parents. Elle commence sa journée à 8 heures pour descendre à 13 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit pour la préparation d’un événement  familial. Son projet futur est d’acquérir son propre école.
texts.en:
Georgette Marie lives in Senegal. She is married and working in the education sector for 5 years. With her income she manages her personal needs and sends money regularly to her parents.

Her workday begins at 8:00 a.m. and ends at 1:00 p.m. She is seeking a loan to prepare a family event. Her future goal is to acquire her own school.

loans.use: to prepare a family event.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 53. She is married, with four children between 14 and 25.  She sells different items, and has been in the business for fifteen years. 

She is requesting a loan of 350,000 RWF; with the loan, she plans to buy more corn flour and cooking oil for sale. 

With the profits, she would like reinvest in the business so that in the future, she may become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more corn flour and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Salimboy

texts.ru: Салимбою 20 лет. Он проживает с родителями в районе Зафаробод города Истаравшан. По окончании школы Салимбой начал заниматься животноводством. Вот уже два года как он покупает крупно-рогатый скот, откармливает его и затем перепродает. В его деле помогает ему семья. Салимбой очень энергичный молодой человек. Он намерен расширить свою дейтельность и берет кредит для купли-продажи скота. За счет прибыли он хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота.
texts.en:
Salimboy is 20 years old. He lives with his parents in the Zafarobod region, in the town of Istaravshan. After school, Salimboy started raising livestock. For two years already, he has been buying large-horned cattle, feeding them, and then reselling them. This work really helps his family. 

Salimboy is a very energetic, young man. He intends to expand his activities and is taking a loan to buy and sell cattle. With the profit he earns, he wants to increase the number of his livestock.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique es un cliente recurrente de Kiva, gracias a su crédito anterior pudo mejorar mucho sus servicios y hoy en día ya esta siendo mas conocido y visitado por mas clientes. Agradece mucho por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, ya que así podrá seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder utilizarlo en la compra de un móvil para su trabajo, el cual le ayudará mucho para visitar a clientes que viven lejos, quiere comprarse un modesto auto y así ir creciendo de a poco.
texts.en:
Enrique is a regular Kiva client. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to improve services and is now better-known and has more customers. He is grateful for the support, which helps him continue to expand and help his family. 

He is applying for a loan to buy a car for work that will let him visit customers who live far away. He wants to buy a no-frills car, which will let him grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат добрая и порядочная женщина. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2  детей. Мухаббат и ее семья живут в сельской местности и занимаются выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Они имеют 1,5 га земли.  Доход от данного бизнеса не хватает для улучшения условия проживания. В данном бизнесе участвуют все члены семьи, как муж Мухаббата, так и дети. Мухаббат решила организовать новый бизнес для получения дополнительного дохода. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов, так как на местном рынке сухофрукты имеют большой спрос. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a kind and decent woman. She is 49 years old. She is married and raising two children. Muhabbat and her family live in a rural area and are engaged in growing crops. They have 1.5 hectares of land. Income from the business is not enough to improve their living conditions. All the members of the famly, Muhabbat's husband and children, are involved in this business. 

Muhabbat decided to start a new business to generate additional income. To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She wants to establish a business buying and selling dried fruits, as there is great demand for dried fruits in the local market. She plan to use the revenue to improve living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy goods, to establish a new business.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for organizing a new business

loans.name: Nietaton Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre  femmes du groupe  NIETATON  ont  en moyenne 42 ans et  3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Hamdallaye de SAN cercle SAN  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font la vente de divers articles et de cosmétiques. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  13e prêt solidaire.
Madame, Kadia  (1ere  personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite avec foulard blanc au coud) excelle  dans la vente produits cosmétiques. Elle  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  2 kg de magnokisseni ½ kg de djekalani et plus de 24 bouteilles de parfum pour la préparation de l’encens. Après avoir faire le mélange pendant plus d’une semaine elle les mets dans les bouteilles de mayonnaise.  Elle s’approvisionne  auprès des grossistes de SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à domicile  dans les bureaux. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Kadia  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the group NIETATON live in extended traditional families in the Hamdallaye district of San, circle of SAN, region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali). They average 42 years of age and three children each, and they know one another as neighbors and through ties of marriage and kinship. They sell miscellaneous merchandise and cosmetic products. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their 13th group loan. 

Mrs. Kadia (standing first from the left and wearing a white scarf) specializes in the sale of cosmetic products.
