texts.en: Kariro is a fifty-eight year old dryland farmer. She is a widow and mother of two children. Kariro is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program to earn money to build a house and expand her goat-keeping endeavor. She currently has one goat, but is planning to purchase more livestock with her profits from her tree farm.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and maintenance support for her tree farm

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia, 55, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rod, a businessman, and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Olivia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by buying inventory at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Olivia hopes to have another store and dreams to have a happy and good life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from the small town of Khashuri. She is 40 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children (21 and 16 years old). Irma requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting a trading business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the lack of experience in her job, which is usually a requirement for the local credit providers. Irma’s business is a small canteen at the local school, where she sells cheese pies, juices and different kinds of snacks among students.
 Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Irma will purchase clothing and bed clothing at wholesale prices and resell them in her town and nearby villages for a profit. It will be hard work for Irma, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a trading business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is a 59-years-old, married woman with two children. She has been managing her mini grocery for over twenty years. She sells a variety of goods in her store such as beverages, soft drinks, and noodles. She would like to increase the variety and stock of her goods in order to attract more consumers. She is requesting additional capital amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, canned goods, biscuits, ice cream, chips and sweets. This amount would be useful in developing her business profit. She hopes that her wish loan will be approved.

loans.use: purchase sugar, coffee, canned goods, biscuits, ice cream, chips and sweets

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 35 years old and is married with three children. To raise her children, Maricel is engaged in hog-raising business. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 7,500 every 5 to 6 months. Maricel wants to have more hogs to raise, but she lack the necessary capital. In this regard, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and to buy feed for them. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: buy additional hogs and hog feed

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 12,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, spices, milk, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Erlinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, spices, milk, etc.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a single man aged 26. He is a repeat client and on his second loan. His first loan was of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) which he serviced well.

Denis did not continue with his education after finishing form four because his parents didn't have money to fund his tuition. So he had to look for businesses in order to provide for his family. He went to a driving school so that he could learn driving, and later on he got into the taxi business because there was a demand by the Sudanese and other business people who wished to offer him a job. He uses the income to pay rent and look after his brother's sons (dependents), saving the balance with Ugafode Micro-finance Ltd.

With the savings, the bought a piece of land for 1,500,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) which he used to save on his account. He has borrowed 1,500,000 UGX in order to buy doors and windows to shutter his incomplete house. His dreams for the future are to finish his house and be able to reduce on the cost of rent so that he can easily pay fees for his bother's children and see them graduate. In the photo Denis is in front of his incomplete house.

loans.use: To buy doors and windows to shutter his house

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 27,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, biscuits, soft drink sand other groceries needed for her general store business.

Lilia has been in this business for 19 years. Lilia earns more income from buying and selling rice, fruit vending and feeds.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock like soap, biscuits, soft drinks, and other groceries needed for her business

loans.name: Khalzankhuu

texts.en:
Khalzankhuu, 49 years old, lives with her husband and seven children in Dornod, eastern province of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Her husband is unemployed and stays at home. Her younger three children go to high school. The eldest son now works at a construction business entity in Ulaanbaatar. Her eldest daughter has a position of saleswoman at a clothes sales entity. Khalzankhuu has been working as a flour mixer and molder at a fancy cakes factory for six consecutive years. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. Khalzankhuu is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to purchase construction materials, such as bricks, cement, planks, and dry boards. 

As a result of the loan, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place, due to a renovated and insulated house. Most importantly, in cold periods, the house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, planks, and dry boards to renovate her house.

loans.name: Cayetana Del Rosario

texts.es: Cayetana, es una humilde comerciante quien se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas, originaria de la ciudad de León, madre de 5 hijos de los cuales ella apoya al menor que estudia Biología. Su primer crédito Kiva, le brindó la oportunidad de comprar materia prima para producir tortillas y conseguir ingresos para ayudar a pagar la carrera de sus hijos. Ahora distribuye su producto a pulperías y vende a domicilio. Siempre sigue con sus planes de mejorar poco a poco el techo de su cocina y poner piso, parte del financiamiento que hoy solicita lo utilizara será para comprar maíz, cal y leña y sacar adelante a su hijo menor para que se supere ya que ella no pudo estudiar.
texts.en: Cayetana is a humble vendor who makes a living making and selling tortillas. She is a native of the city of León and mother to 5 children, the youngest of whom studies Biology and who she supports. Her first Kiva loan gave her the opportunity to buy raw ingredients to produce tortillas and obtain an income to help to pay for her children's studies. Cayetana now distributes her products to small grocery stores and sells from door to door. She continues to pursue her plans of improving the roof of her kitchen little by little and lay down flooring. Part of the financing that she is seeking today will be used to buy corn, quicklime and firewood, as well as to get her youngest child ahead in life so that he succeeds given that she was unable to study.

loans.use: to buy corn, quicklime and firewood.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a responsible housekeeper who operates a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village. She is married and has two children attending school. She wants to offer more products in order to gain higher profits but she has insufficient funds. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy soft drinks, eggs, noodles, breads and biscuits to sell in her store. She promises to keep improving her sales if lenders will provide her hoped-for loan, which will allow her to give a better education and standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, noodles, breads and biscuit

loans.name: Juan Alvaro

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Juan pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juan trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, regalos y adicionalmente trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, tales como prendas de vestir, adornos, regalos y otros, de esta manera Juan tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Juan is a 21-year-old, he is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a keen desire to succeed. Thanks to his hard work and the support of his parents, Juan was able to pursue studies in Gastronomy. In his spare time he likes to prepare delicious desserts and he sometimes cooks a sumptuous dish of Ají de Gallina to share with his family.

At his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Juan works in his small store selling clothes and presents. He also works as a kitchen assistant in a restaurant in his city. He works every day from the early hours of the morning, and he can do so for roughly 10 hours. Juan feels content with his work and believes that it is going well thanks to the good customer service he offers his customers.

Juan is extremely grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able buy a larger volume of merchandise such as clothing, decorations, presents and others. In this way, Juan will have a business that is better set up, and so he will continue working and make every effort to achieve his greatest dream of having his own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Orfilia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 57 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Ella lleva aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a la sastrería. Confecciona camisas, pantalones, cortinas, ropa de cama, faldas, forros de muebles etc. Cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta área de la confección. Ha obtenido de ODEF  doce préstamos, los que le han ayudado a mantener el negocio. El préstamo actual es por 5,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para comprar telas, hilos, y otros materiales para realizar los trabajos pendientes que tiene. Su meta es mantener activo su negocio y su clientela para lograr tener solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Doña María is 57 years old and a single mother with four children. She lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

María has worked as a tailor for more than 30 years. She produces shirts, trousers, curtains, bedding, skirts, furniture covers, and other items. María has plenty of experience in the area of sewing. She has obtained 12 ODEF loans, which have helped to maintain her business.

Her current loan is in the amount of 5,000 HNL and will be used to buy fabrics, thread, and other materials for completing her outstanding orders. Her goal is to maintain an active business and clientele so that she can achieve financial solvency.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and other materials.

loans.name: Natividad Ramona

texts.es: Natividad, madre soltera, habitante de la ciudad de León, se dedica a vender comida negocio que comparte con su familia.   Su  primer préstamo le beneficio mucho pues logro comprar verduras y granos básicos para hacer comida, antes no tenía mucho capital con que trabajar y el financiamiento llego cuando más lo necesitaba, logro pagar satisfactoriamente. Siempre mantiene su lucha por lograr poner su comideria con mejores condiciones, que es por lo cual lucha cada para poder vender más y ahorrar para lograr tener su puesto de comida formal. Hoy está necesitando financiamiento para comprar frijoles, azúcar, aceite, vegetales, carne, pollo y empaque para comida.
texts.en:
Natividad is a single mother that lives in León. She sells food, helped by her family. Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to buy vegetables and grains for preparing food. Before, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments in time.

She always struggles to improve her food stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Natividad is requesting a loan to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken and food packaging.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken and food packaging.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor vive en Guayaquil, tiene 62 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio desde hace 5 años, debía aportar a su hogar ya que el ingreso no abastecía. Y debido a esto empezó a invertir en una venta de gaseosas.

La dificultad que tiene es de no poder tener un local para su mercadería sino que el negocio lo tiene en su propia vivienda y esto le dificulta un poco.

No está casada, no tiene hijos. El trabajo lo realiza sola sin mantener a nadie para así poder generar mayores ingresos y poder sustentarse en los gastos de su hogar.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construccion para un local comercial y asi exhibir sus productos a los clientes como bebidas y viveres. Con esto tendra mayor dinero y mas clientela.
texts.en:
Flor lives in Guayaquil and is 62 years old. She started her business five years ago because she needed to sustain her household, but was not earning an income. For this reason, she began investing in the sale of sodas.

One obstacle is that she does not have a place for her merchandise. Since her business is located in her home, this proves to be a bit difficult. Flor is not married and does not have any children. She works alone without having to support anyone. As a result, she can earn more income to pay for her household expenses.

With this loan, Flor will buy construction materials so that she can have a shop where she can display products, such as beverages and food items, to her customers. In the end, she will have more income and more customers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a store.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
La señora Santa Petrona esta casada, tiene 26 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos pequeños los cuales aun no están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos y a la crianza de animales, inicio este negocio comprado algunas gallinas y cerdos, hasta el momento lleva  7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica  a la confección de tejidos.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de animales para crianza, específicamente la crianza de gallinas ponedora y cerdos, espera en el futuro contar con una pequeña granja de animales domésticos, Las demás integrantes se dedican a la confección de tejidos, producción agrícola, artesanía y crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Santa Petrona is married, she is 26 years old, and completed the four years of primary education. She has two young children who are not yet studying. Santa Petrona makes her living producing textiles and rearing animals. She started this business selling hen and pigs. She has 7 years of experience in this field and she has the support of her husband who makes his living producing textiles.

She organizes a group in order to seek a loan that she will use to buy animals for rearing, specifically to raise laying hens and pigs. In the future, she hopes to have a small farm of domestic animals. The rest of the members make their living producing textiles, agricultural production, handicrafts and animal rearing.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and pigs.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, de 66 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Edulvina, con quien tiene 7 hijos. Ahora viven solos en la casa rústica que compraron hace 48 años.  
Desde niño aprendió de sus padres el noble oficio de la agricultura, desde entonces supo lo importante que es el campo . Cuando tuvo 28 años, empezo de manera independiente a sembrar y negociar sus alimentos. Comenta que sus principales cultivos constan de zanahoria, papa y alfalfa en todas sus variedades, en la actualidad posee sus propios terrenos agrícolas de extensas áreas y todas productivas que contribuyen con el crecimiento económico que tiene. “Gracias a la agricultura obtuve muchas ganancias, pude mejorar mi calidad de vida y sacar a mis hijos adelante”, menciona contento mientras sonríe, “todos son agricultores como yo”, afirma. Ahora desea seguir sembrando y continuar con la agricultura, pues es lo único que aprendió desde que nació.
En está oportunidad está solicitando 1500 soles, en todo el tiempo que trabajó con su asociación obtuvo reiteradas oportunidades de apoyo financiero, por lo que es un socio conocido y cumplido, prometiendo ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Víctor, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues dentro de poco podrá cosechar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Victor, who is 66 years old, is a hard-working man. He lives with his wife Edulvina, and they have 7 children. Now they live alone in a rustic house they bought some 48 years ago.  

From his youth, Victor learned from his parents the noble calling of agriculture. Since then,  he has understood the importance of the countryside. When he was 28 years old, he began independently to sow and negotiate concerning his food crops.  Victor comments that his principal crops are carrots, potatoes, and alfalfa in all its varieties. At present, he possesses his own extensive agricultural lands and all of them are productive, which contributes to his economic growth. “Thanks to agriculture, I earned a lot, and was able to improve my quality of life and advance my children,” Victor says and smiles contentedly. “They are all farmers like me,” he affirms. Now Victor wishes to continue sowing and working in agriculture, since it is all he has learned since his birth.

On this occasion, Victor is soliciting 1,500 sols. During all the time he has worked with his association, he has obtained reiterated opportunities for financial help. For that reason, he is a well-known and compliant member who promises to be punctual in making his payments.

Victor will invest the money in purchasing organic fertilizer to nurture his plantings, since shortly, it will be harvest time for his food crops.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer for his food crops.

loans.name: Shikulu Group

texts.en:
Protus, a member of Shikulu Group in Kakamega South District, is pictured on the right with his hand raised, one of 13 One Acre Fund farmers consisting of ten women and three men. Protus, who is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation, first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2006 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Protus described his harvest last year as good, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Protus’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land. The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Inocencio Ezequiel

texts.es:
Inocencio vive en Libertad, tiene 45 años de edad. El empezó su negocio con venta de madera, en una empresa y luego emprendió su propio negocio pero con poca madera para ver qué tal le resultaba la venta. Luego fue aumentando más y más hasta ahora.

El trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposa, ya que el negocio lo tiene en su propio vivienda, por el momento no presenta de ninguna dificultad. Está casado, su esposa también trabaja vendiendo ropa y productos AVON y L-BEL, tiene tres hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo Inocencio quiere comprar más madera para el negocio y que así su negocio siga creciendo. Para tener mejores ingresos de dinero y así poder mantener su familias y aportar en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Inocencio lives in Libertad, and is 45 years old.  He started his own business selling wood.  He learned this activity working for a business, and then later started up his own business with a small amount of wood to see what kind of sales he could generate. Later, he gradually expanded the business up to its current size.

His wife works with him in the business, and he operates the business from his own home.  At the present time, he is not having any difficulties with it.  He is married, and his wife also sells clothing and Avon and L-Bel products.  They have 3 children who study in the local public school.

With this loan, Inocencio wants to buy more wood for his business so that his business can continue to grow.  This will enable him to generate more income so that he can support his family and contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wood for his business

loans.name: Sonia Marilu

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 35 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene tres hijos.  Vive junto a su compañero de vida, sus tres hijos y su mamá. Tiene tres años de dedicarse al comercio de refrescos, papitas fritas, pupusas, todos los días y manifiesta que gracias al apoyo de su compañero de vida lo ha podido mantener. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más materia prima para elaborar la venta de comestibles; ya que en esta época hay muchos turistas en la zona y sus ventas se duplican. Con las ganancias espera construir un cafetín a la orilla de la laguna.
texts.en:
Sonia, 35, is married and has three children.  She lives with her life partner, her three children, and her mother.

Every day for three years she has made a living selling soda, fried potatoes, and pupusas [stuffed tortillas].  She says she has been able to support it thanks to the help of her life partner.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy more ingredients to make her food to sell, because this time of year there are a lot of tourists in the area and her sales double.

She hopes to build a small cafe on the shore of a lake with her profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make food

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO NUEVA ESPERANZA
El grupo está conformado por la señora Angelica se dedica a la venta de tortilla, comida, y frijol venta que tiene ubicada en su domicilio  desde hace seis años  ella tiene una niña menor de edad  y su deseo es seguir adelante para ser un apoyo para su esposo  y así mismo colocar otra venta de tortillería  en otro lugar y a la vez agradece la confianza por tener en los créditos otorgados. el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de maiz y leña para la elaboracion de tortillas.
texts.en: The Duo Nuevo Esperanza group was set up by Angelica who makes her living selling tortillas, food and beans, a sales point she has located in her home for the last six years. She has a young daughter and her dream is to get ahead in life to support her husband and therein set up another tortilla food stall. She is grateful for the confidence shown in her with the loans she has been given. The loan she is now seeking is to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, age 51, buys and sells fruits and vegetables to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for over five years. While she does not make much money through her business, she has four responsible grown children with their own livelihoods who help her, and this inspires her to keep trying to improve her venture. 

Myrna would like to enhance her current business in order to achieve a better profit. She has realized that retailing gasoline is a profitable source of income, so she has decided to supplement her current business by offering gasoline to her customers. 

She does not have sufficient capital for this investment at present, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000, which she will use to buy both gasoline and vegetables to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy both gasoline and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie runs a sari-sari (general store) business to earn an income. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, an investment that gave her the opportunity for higher income. She has been engaged this business for five years now and it is continuously growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for the family's everyday expenses,

She would like to apply for another PhP 35,000 loan, which will allow her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She believes that the more items she can display at the store, the better. Having a greater variety of items to sell will result in better profits, which will be a great help in sustaining her family’s daily needs and supporting her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lanie's dreams are for her youngest child to finish his studies and for her business to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory

loans.name: Baasannyambuu

texts.en:
Baasannyambuu, 48 years old, lives with his family in Dornod, eastern province of Mongolia. The family resides in a four-walled, traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. His wife works at a construction business in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

Baasannyambuu has been running a tractor at a military unit in the borderland. During wintertime, running a tractor at the military base is not needed, so Baasannyambuu works as a watchman, instead. He works for two days and takes one day off. During the day off, he renders taxi services to local people, using his own automobile.  

The ger they live in has deteriorated over the past years and it is about time the family changed their dwelling. Baasannyambuu is requesting a loan of MNT 1,800,000 to purchase a five-walled, traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling). 

A five-walled, traditional Mongolian ger has more space and is a lot warmer than the four-walled version. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. Baasannyambuu is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a five-walled, traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling).

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan, age 41, runs a transportation business with his truck, delivering products on order. He is also involved in an agricultural business. He lives in a small village in the Bolnisi district with his wife and daughter. The family has six milk cows and eight calves. They also grow maize and potatoes on 3.5 hectares  of agricultural land. They sell the harvested products locally. Levan is a very hard-working man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. 

He has requested a loan to be utilized for land cultivation. After his land is cultivated, he will be able to sow more potatoes and maize, thus increasing the income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. 

Levan is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to cultivate his farmland in preparation for sowing potatoes and maize

loans.name: Loyce's Group

texts.en:
Loyce, age 32, is a farmer who grows maize and peas to earn a living. She also keeps goats. Her husband is a driver and they have five children.

Both Loyce's agricultural businesses face the challenges of water and food shortages. She decided to join the KOMAZA microforestry program because she saw that other members of her community were growing trees as members of the program and they were doing well. With her loan funds, Loyce intends to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support.

With the profits from her tree farm, Loyce plans to pay for her children's educations and to meet the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens to rear

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita operates a fishing business. She earns additional income from buying and selling shells and fermented shrimp. She and her husband have 10 children, and they work hard to support the family.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her past several loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 29,500 through NWTF, which she will use to buy fish netting and other equipment for her fishing business. 

Rodita hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish netting and other equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa, age 52, runs a sari-sari (variety store) business to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for more than three years. In her store, she sells various goods and commodities to people in her local community. Procesa and her husband have five children and live in Bohol.

Procesa is requesting a loan in order to buy grocery items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries. In this way, she will be able to cater better to her buyers' needs. The investment will augment her sales and income.

In the future, Procesa hopes to expand her store and support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, age 54, raises hogs to earn an income. She works hard, and she tells us that she enjoys it because she is able to exercise as she works. Though this promotes a healthy lifestyle, she says she cannot deny that the work is very difficult. Nevertheless, she remains patient and hard-working, and she maintains her business as well as she can.

Juliet is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 25,000, which she will use to purchase feed, vitamins, and three more hogs. 

She hopes that her business will improve and that she can realize higher proceeds through this investment.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and three more hogs

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina runs a general store business. She earns additional income from food vending. She and her husband have four children, and they work hard to support the family.

Melodina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 16,000 through NWTF, which she will use to purchase grocery items such as snacks and canned foods to offer for sale in her store.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to enable her to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as snacks and canned foods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Las Iluminadas Group

texts.es:
Johanna tiene una tienda donde vende zapatos usados, venta de ropa interior y perfumes. Se entregan zapatos usados en diferentes negocios, los compra en la feria libre y los repara y los vende al precio mayor. Hace 14 años que se dedica a esta venta. A veces vende pelotas tambien. Johanna tiene 33 años y es mama soltera que cuida por sus 4 hijos, los mayores tienen 18, 11 y 7 años y todos estudian. El menor tiene 2 años. A lo largo plazo, a Johanna le gustaría poner un local en Renaico (IX Región) en su ciudad. Eventualmente, quiere postular para obtener una casa. Johanna le gusta Fondo Esperanza por  los cursos de capacitación, poder trabajar en grupo y conocer más gente de su comunidad y dar a conocer su negocio entre las personas de su comunidad.
Johanna es la segunda sentada atrás, de derecha a izquierda con polera morada y pelo tomado.
texts.en:
Johanna has a place where she sells underwear, perfume, and used shoes.  Used shoes are available in various businesses.  She buys them in the outdoor market, repairs them, and sells them at a higher price.  She has done this job for 14 years.  Sometimes she also sells balls.

Johanna, 33, is a single mother who takes care of her four children.  The older ones, ages 18, 11, and 7 years old, are all in school.  The youngest is 2.

In the long term, Johanna would like to set up a store in Renaico (Region 9), in her city.  Eventually she wants to apply to get a house.

Johanna likes Fondo Esperanza because of the training classes, being able to work in a group, getting to know more people in her community, and making her business known in her community.

Johanna is seated in the back, the second person from the right, wearing a purple t-shirt and her hair pulled back.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and materials to repair shoes

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Jalia has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells soft drinks and foods. 

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a fridge, as well as more bread, cakes and soda for the business. This will help Jalia to generate greater profits and take good care of herself and her family. Jalia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Jalia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and more bread, cakes, and soda for the business

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en: Ernalyn is 33 years of age, married and blessed with two children. She has raised hogs for over 5 years. She dreams of improving the quality of living for her family but because of insufficient profits she was not be able to provide what she aspires too. Ernalyn really wants to have a good income, this led her then to ask for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy vitamins and feed to nourish the hogs. She knows that this loan will help her business to produce bountiful proceeds as long as she continues with her hard work.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, 57, is a determined woman who wants to go ahead in her business and lead her family out of poverty. Despite having hardships and financial shortages, Khim devotes herself to full time work at the paddy field, growing rice for harvest twice a year, with great support from her partner and children. Khim has been a farmer for more than 30 years.

The reason Khim is requesting a loan is to pay for the food costs that will be incurred in the wedding party of her last-born child. She would be glad if she could manage the costs of the party well. She hopes that the loan will be granted to help her family in this special time of need.

loans.use: to pay food costs for her child's wedding.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more merchandise and has been able to earn a larger income. She is already six years in this business and it has helped them a lot in terms of finances. She is also a jeepney operator. She together with her husband works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise and products to increase her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Editha hopes that her business will grow more and dreams to give a good life to her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José  tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero.  Vive junto a su mamá y dos hermanos; él es albañil y esta contratado en un proyecto de construcción. Además, es agricultor, oficio que aprendió de su padre, quien le heredo un terreno para que cultivara ahí. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar teja para el techo de su casa; pues algunas están quebradas, comprara agroquímicos para el cultivo de maíz y para cancelar una deuda pendiente con la institución. Con la inversión mejorara su vivienda, ya que tiene muchos problemas de filtraciones de agua. Su deseo, es comprar unos cerdos para la crianza de estos.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old and single, and he lives with his mother and two siblings. He is a construction worker and has a contract on a construction project. He is also a farmer, a trade which he learned from his father, who bequeathed him a piece of land for him to cultivate.

The loan that he is applying for from Fundación Campo is to buy tiles for the roof of his house, as some are broken, to buy agrochemicals for growing corn, and to pay off an outstanding debt with the institution. With this investment he will improve his home, which has a lot of problems with water leakage. His hope is to buy some pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy tiles for the roof of his house and agrochemicals for growing corn, and to pay off an outstanding debt with the institution.

loans.name: Sevilla Group

texts.es: Las prestatarios del grupo Sevilla trababan en la compra y venta de fruta y verdura, artesanía y comida. Veronica hace artesanía como las mecedoras, costureros, cosas para el día de la madre y del niño. Vende a pedido directamente a personas. Usa productos reciclados para sus productos. Veronica tiene otro trabajo para poder tener estabilidad y va a usar el préstamo para comprar mercadería. En el futuro ella quiere vivir solo de la venta de sus artesanías y que fuera su única fuente de ingreso. Veronica es mama soltera y vive con sus padres, tiene 37 años. Tiene una hija de 16 años que estudia en la universidad. Le gusta trabajar con Fondo Esperanza porque le permite soñar y pensar en establecer su negocio y no seguir siendo dependiente sino que un negocio propio e independiente. También porque ha conocido gente y ha podido establecer lazos con el grupo
texts.en:
The borrowers from the Sevilla group work in the buying and selling of fruit and vegetables, handicraft and food. 

Veronica makes crafts like rocking chairs, sewing boxes, and things for mother's day and children's day. She sells on demand directly to people. She uses recycled materials for her products. 

Veronica has another job so that she can have some stability, and she is going to use the loan to buy merchandise. In the future she wants to live on just the sale of her handicrafts, so that that will be her only source of income.

Veronica is a single mum and she lives with her parents. She is 37 years old. She has a 16 year old daughter who studies at university. She likes working with Fondo Esperanza because it lets her dream and think about establishing her business and not keep being dependent but have her own independent business. She also likes it because she has got to know people and been able to establish ties with the group.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her handicraft

loans.name: Eshibanga Group

texts.en:
Eshibanga is a group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District represented by Rose. The group has 11 women and two men. Rose is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Rose joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Rose joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

Rose described her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer last year as good, and she hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to repair her home and save for the future. Rose’s group members will each receive input loans of one half acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for six and a half acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos.  Vive junto a su compañero de vida que es agricultor y una nieta que esta estudiando. Ella se encargaba de administrar su propia tienda durante cinco años; pero su compañero de vida enfermo y se vio obligada a cerrarla.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mercadería para la tienda; ya que desea aperturarla nuevamente; pero no en su casa sino a la orilla de la calle principal y para preparar la tierra para la siembra de maíz con sistema de riego, pago de arrendamiento y mano de obra. De esta manera, asegurara el alimento para la familia.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old, married and has two children.  She lives with her life partner, who is a farmer, and a granddaughter who is studying.  She was responsible for managing her own store for five years; but her life partner got sick and she had to shut down her store.  

The loan she is applying to Fundación Campo for, is to buy merchandise for the store so that she can open it again -- not in her house, but by the side of the main road -- to prepare the land for planting corn with an irrigation system, and to pay for rent and labor.  In this way, she will ensure food for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the store, to prepare the land for planting corn, and to pay for rent and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy firewood and fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
This is Augustina, 56, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eligio, a mechanical engineer. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Augustina maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Augustina's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 5000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Augustina hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a good life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela earns a living through her retailing business selling various items like kitchenware, personal and cosmetic care products, and food and beverages like eggs and cocoa drink. Fidela is asking for a loan to buy household and kitchenware, cosmetics and wellness products like ointment and others. 

In the future, Fidela has hopes of making her business grow and become successful.

loans.use: to buy household and kitchenware, cosmetics and wellness products like ointments, etc.

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel’s group has 13 farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Emmanuel is pictured on the right of Imani Group with his hand raised. Emmanuel is pictured amongst the 3 men and 10 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Emmanuel first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Emmanuel joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to improve his farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Emmanuel reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to harvest about 9 bags of maize per acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 17 bags per acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and repay his loan. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Emmanuel’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 1/2 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Mean is aged 55 years old and married. She and her husband have five children, only one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting sapodilla trees and they have been in this business for almost thirty-five years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 12,000 KHR per day to support her family.
 
This is the first loan for Mean with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. Mean, the leader, will use her portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use, so as to provide a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a decent latrine

loans.name: Silvia Priscila

texts.es:
SILVIA PRISCILA
La  señora Silvia Priscila de 23 años de edad esta casada tiene 1 hija de 3 años de edad, Su negocio de ella es una librería tiene ya 4 años de tener su negocio cuando ella comenzó con su librería vendía algunos cuadernos, lapiceros  y tenía un mostrador muy viejo, actualmente su librería esta surtida tiene varios mostradores  y una variedad de productos que ofrece a su comunidad ya que ella se encuentra ubicada cerca de la escuela de la comunidad, ella solicita un crédito  para comprar algunos mostradores(muebles) porque tiene más demanda de consumo de materiales y no cuenta con mobiliario para mostrarlo en su negocio y tambien ampliar mas su librería ya que ella también vende otros tipos de productos en su librería (dulces, helados, regalos para el día del cariño, de la madre, etc.) su meta más adelante es llegar  comprar una fotocopiadora y comprar una computadora para  utilizarlo en su negocio ya que no cuenta con estos recursos y son muy solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia Priscila, 23, is married and has a three-year-old daughter.  Her business is a bookstore that she has had for four years.  When she started with her bookstore she sold some notebooks and pens, and she had a very old display case.  Currently her bookstore is stocked and she has several display cases and a variety of products she sells to her community, because she's located near the community school.

She's requesting a loan to buy some display cases (furniture) because she has more demand to buy materials but doesn't have the furniture to display them in her business.  She's also going to expand her bookstore because she sells other products (sweets, ice cream, gifts for Valentine's Day and Mother's Day, etc.).

Her long-term goal is to buy a photocopier and a computer to use in her business because she doesn't have these resources and her customers request them frequently.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her store

loans.name: Rosiel

texts.en:
This is Rosiel, 29, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ariel, a welder, and a mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosiel operates a food processing business. She has a factory a few steps from her house where they manufacture meat products. She earns by selling her goods to her neighbors and to suppliers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosiel dreams of being successful in her business and hopes to have a good life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of frozen and processed foods like hot dogs, ham, sausages and more

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur is a 37-year-old man from Bolnisi District. He is divorced. Khachatur works as an artisan locally and gets a monthly income. In addition, he runs a small dairy farm with a calf and a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Khachatur also trades fruits and vegetables. He purchases products from wholesalers once a week and sells them in the local market. Khachatur works hard to generate some savings and improve his living conditions. 

With the requested loan, Khachatur will purchase stock of vegetables and fruits to sell them for a profit and expand his trading business. That will increase his profit. Khachatur plans to reinvest part of the profit in the same business and the rest will be used in everyday expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Betzil

texts.es:
Betzil tiene 24 años, se encuentra comprometida con Efrain de 34 años y tiene una gran motivación que es su pequeña Ariana de un añito.Reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble en calidad de alquiler junto a  su pequeña familia.Anteriormente apoyaba a su madre en la venta de comida en una feria local para años después al formalizar su relación con Efraín y gracias a un  capital ahorrado hasta entonces lograron aperturar un salón de belleza en una local alquilado dentro de la zona céntrica de su localidad.Gracias a la habilidad que obtuvo en un curso acelerado de peluquería puede mediante su negocio aportar firmemente a la economía familiar.Comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo,puesto que en esta temporada del año la afluencia de clientes es muy buena por esta razon desea contar con capital para la compra de insumos de belleza y tener disponible el servicio de teñido y otras atenciones solicitados por sus clientes.
Su objetivos a largo plazo es ganar lo suficiente para  adquirir un lote de terreno y posteriormente iniciar la construcción de su vivienda para establecer su negocio de la misma forma.
Este es su primer crédito, esta muy contenta por la oportunidad y espera cumplir de manera responsable con el pago de sus cuotas por esta razón desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de tintes para cabello y accesorios de belleza como ganchos, colets y adornos hechos a basa de bisutería.
texts.en:
Betzil is 24 years old and engaged to 34-year-old Efrain. She has a great source of motivation, which is her little one-year-old Ariana. She lives with her small family in a rented house built with noble materials. She used to help her mother sell food at a local fair. Years later, when her relationship with Efrain became official, thanks to some savings they successfully opened a beauty salon in a rented space located within the central area of her town. Thanks to the skills she learned from an accelerated hairdressing class, she's able to use her business to solidly contribute to her family's finances. She reports that she enjoys her work very much, because during this time of the year the influx of customers is very good. For that reason she wishes to have enough capital to purchase beauty supplies and provide hair dyeing as well as other services that are requested by her customers.
Her long-term goal is to earn enough money to purchase a plot of land. Then later on she'll start building her house and establish her business in a similar way.
This is her first loan. She's very glad to get this opportunity and hopes to comply with her repayments in a responsible fashion. For that reason she wishes to receive 1000 nuevos soles in order to purchase hair dye and beauty accessories such as hair clips, ponytail holders and brooches made of costume jewelry.

loans.use: to purchase hair dye and beauty accessories.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: Boubacar est un commerçant qui tient une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires notamment de produits agricoles.Il est marié et père de trois enfants.Après une expérience d'immigration de deux ans en Algérie, il est revenu dans sa localité pour se consacrer à cette activité de commerce qui lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300 000f pour acheter des produits agricoles qu'il va stocker et revendre au meilleur prix.Son ambition est d'agrandir son magasin et de renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Boubacar is a merchant who runs a grocery store where he sells agricultural products, among other things. He is married with three children. After living in Algeria for two years, he returned to his hometown to dedicate himself to this activity, which brings in substantial income and allows him to support his family’s needs and most of his own. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 300,000f to buy agricultural products, which he will store for resale at a better price. 

His goal is to expand his store and bolster his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for resale.

loans.name: Sang'alo F Group

texts.en:
Sang'alo F is a group of 11 farmers in Bungoma South District represented by Edward. The group has eight women and three men. Edward is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum will be delivered to him on credit.  Edward first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2006 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Edward joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Edward described his harvest as good last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Edward’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 1/2 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 41 year-old single man who has been selling fresh chickens for 12 years to make his own living.  Mohamad is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua so that he can increase his business merchandise with a big quantity of live chickens in order to be capable of meeting his customers' needs. This loan will help him increase his business capital, which will improve his income and living.

This is Mohamad's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower.  He hopes with the future loans he will be capable of making his dream of opening a chicken farm come true.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with a big quantity of live chickens

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is a food vendor from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of six children. Leonida is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasonings, cooking oil, and flour. This will enable her to cook and sell more food to the people in her area thus increasing her sales and income. Leonida hopes to make her business successful and sustainable in the future. Moreover, she wants to continue to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasonings, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
Charish is 37 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Charish is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy pig feed and piglets for her business.

Charish has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, de 38 años de edad, casado, padre de 3 hijos de 14,12 y 10 años de edad respectivamente, todos están estudiando la primaria en una pequeña escuelita cerca de la comarca donde viven. 
Él se crio en la comunidad Escobillo una pequeña comunidad rural en las afueras de Teustepe municipio de Boaco. Inicio a trabajar con su papa a los 12 años de edad en las labores de agricultura al cumplir 20 años de edad se casó y se independizo trabajando con sus propios medios, sembrando frijol, maíz y trigo también criando ganado y cerdos. Sus actividades las realiza junto con un mozo el cual le paga para que le ayude a limpiar el terreno y sembrar, su producción lo vende en la capital donde le pagan un mejor precio por su cosecha. 
Él está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra para sembrar frijol. El espera que con las ganancias  pagar su crédito y lograr comprar ganado para producción de leche.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old, married, and a father of 3 children (ages 14, 12, and 10, respectively).  They are all in elementary school in a small school near where they live.  He grew up in the Escobillo community, which is a smal, rural community in the outskirts of Teustepe and the city of Boaco.  

He started to work with his dad at 12 years of age in farming.  When he turned 20-years-old, he married and became independent.  He works with his own resources, sowing beans, corn, and wheat while also raising cows and pigs.  He also works with a farmhand, who he pays to help him keep up the land and plant.  He sells his goods in the capital, where he is paid a better price for his harvest.

He is in need of funding to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, and pay his farmhand to plant beans.  He expects to pay his debt with the profits and be able to buy cows for milk production.

loans.use: buy manure, seeds, and fertilizer as well as pay a laborer to plant his bean crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase a solar home system that will allow him to stop relying on expensive and hazardous candles. They will be able to extend their working hours and carry out productive activities for their ranch.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: have access to electricity through solar energy for the first time in their lives, which they will use to improve the quality of the education of their children, and use the night hours to do productive activities.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
Las Mariposas es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 10 personas cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica: Noemi venta de refrescos, Salvador venta de comida, Cintia venta de artículos para el hogar, Ana Bertha venta de refrescos, Maria Elizabeth venta de cosméticos, Maria Felix  venta de cosmeticos, Alicia venta de pollo, Mario venta de carne, Maria venta de antojitos y Magdalena venta de carne. Este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de Teleta donde la principal actividad económica es siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar.


Ana Bertha platica que desde pequeña aprendió que trabajando se gana la vida así que hace mas de 5 años decidió iniciar a vender refrescos en su hogar con la intención de ganarse su propio dinero para ayudar a su esposo con el gasto del hogar. 

Ella dijo "a mi me gusta mi actividad porque la hago desde mi casa y sin descuidar a mi familia, Muchas gracias por su apoyo y prestamos que nos dan"


Ana Bertha tiene 38 años y completó su educación hasta el segundo grado de la escuela secundaria. Ella y  su esposo David tienen tres hijos que ya están casados.

Para que su negocio crezca y sea más rentable Ana Bertha necesita comprar diferentes tipos de refrescos para vender. Un préstamo de VisionFund le permitirá comprar los productos que necesita y Ana Bertha cree que esto ayudará a que su negocio tenga éxito.
texts.en:
"Las Mariposas" is the name of a group made up of ten people. Each of them has a financial activity: Noemi sells soft drinks, Salvador sells food, Cintia sells home goods, Ana sells soft drinks, Maria Elizabeth sells cosmetics, Maria Felix sells cosmetics, Alicia sells chicken, Mario sells meat, and Maria sells traditional corn-based Mexican dishes. This group is located in the Teleta community where the main economical activity is the cultivation of sugarcane. 

Ana says that since she was little, she learned that working earns a living. So, more than five years ago, she decided to begin selling soft drinks in her home with the intention of earning her own money to help her husband with home expenses. 

She said, "I enjoy my activity because I do it from home and without neglecting my family. Thank you very much for the support and loans that you give us."

Ana is 38 years old and she completed her education up to the second grade of secondary school. She and her husband David have three children who are already married.

To grow her business and be more profitable, Ana needs to buy different types of soft drinks to sell. A loan from VisionFund will allow her to buy the products that she needs. Ana believes that this will help her business be successful.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan started Rad Rags in 1989, providing custom tie-dyed clothing. She has been operating the business out of her home, located in the San Joaquin Valley of California. She has the clothes manufactured in California-based factories and custom dyes them individually by hand in unique colors and designs. She sells her products at festivals and events, as well as through her online store (www.radragsscrubs.com).

Susan is the sole caregiver to her aging mother. This has limited her ability to travel to events to showcase her inventory. This has negatively impacted sales. 

This loan will aid Susan in the process of moving her business to a small location in Turlock, California, near several professional and healthcare businesses. The new location will allow her to showcase her inventory and spend more time with her mother.

More recently, the business has started to offer custom tie-dyed scrubs for medical professionals. Susan has generated a lot of interest from healthcare professionals looking for something different.

Susan received business planning assistance from her local Small Business Development Center. She was referred to Fresno CDFI because banks in her area are not interested in lending such small amounts.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and open a retail location.

loans.name: Yelba Argentina

texts.es: La señora Yelba mujer trabajadora, humilde habitante del municipio de la Concepcion, junto a su familia, su esposa tiene  su negocio es comerciante de Frutas, ella cultiva Pitahaya y actualmente requiere de capital para comprar fertilizantes e insumos para darle mantenimiento a su siembra y evitar las plagas. con este credito podra comprar lo necesario asi podra obtener una buena cosecha y sus ingresos incremnetarar por la calidad de su producto.
texts.en:
Yelba is a hardworking and modest woman who lives in the town of La Concepción with her family.  Her husband has his business selling fruits.  She grows dragon fruit and currently needs capital to be able to buy fertilizer and supplies to take care of her crop and avoid pests.

With this loan she'll be able to buy what she needs to get a good harvest and to increase her income because of the quality of her crop.

loans.use: to take care of her crop

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn has been running her dress shop for five years.  Originally, she set up selling bridal gowns, prom and special occasion attire, but as time has gone on, she has seen many women and men who have struggled finding formal attire.  With regards to this situation, Jonalyn has undergone a series of trainings to improve her sales and profit.  Nowadays, she doesn't offer only bridal gowns.   Instead, she also sews some sportswear and school uniforms.  Since her business is growing, she is also in need of additional capital for continuous expansion and improvement of the quality of dresses she offers to her customers.  She is requesting a loan of PHP15,000, allowing her to buy stocks of garments, dress accessories, buttons, zippers, garters and some thread.  She hopes to get this loan amount in order to become popular and earn greater income so she can secure her family's future and obtain a better way of  living someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of garments, dress accessories, buttons, zippers, garters and some thread for her dress shop

loans.name: Boyukaga

texts.en:
Boyukaga is a 38 year-old man who is married and has three children. He is a market vendor and sells spare parts for cars in a rented garage. He has eight years of experience in this field. He is doing his business alone and nobody helps him. He chose spare parts which are in high demand, particularly for Russian cars and for Mercedes. His monthly income is 400 AZN.  In this region, it is hard to find quality spare parts because most of them are expensive and hard to find. Boyukaga wants to change the current situation and start selling this kind of product. 

He applied for 1200 AZN to make a small renovation to his shop and to purchase expensive spare parts to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: to buy expensive spare parts

loans.name: Alde

texts.en: Alde is a 61 year-old married woman and a mother of three grown children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than ten years now. Alde is asking for a loan worth 8000PHP to buy feeds and supplements for the pigs. In the future, Alde hopes to make her business a success and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy feeds and supplements

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: With her previous loan, Haya was able to pay for her semester fees.  Now she is applying for another educational loan that will also supports her in paying for the next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old.  She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  Grace is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 20,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Grace has been buying and selling livestock for seven years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF.  Grace successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her livestock business.  In the future, Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay is 28 years old.  She is married and has two dependent children. She resides with her family in a small thatched house that is located in Roung Kou village, Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has been cultivating her 1.5 hectares of farm land for more than 10 years. It’s quite hard work for her.  However, she is happy to see her farming business going well. Encouraging and supporting her two children in school is her lifetime wish. Hay’s husband helps her manage their farm in the rainy season and spends the rest of his time working as a paid laborer for extra income.

Hay’s husband decided to go to Thailand, where he can earn a higher income than in Cambodia. But he doesn’t have money for a passport. In this regard, Hay would like to obtain a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to pay for a passport, so she can help her husband to work in the neighboring country legally. She hopes that her income will be improved to sustain her living needs and she can continue to be involved in other types of business pursuits.

loans.use: to pay for a passport, so she can help her husband to work in the neighboring country legally.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 36 years old and has three school-age children. She is engaged in buying and selling dried fish in their village to help her husband in generating income. She aims to improve the business and increase her income in order to cover their necessities and support the education of her children. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell. She is hoping that this loan will help her improve the business and hoping that she will make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell

loans.name: Mwachupa

texts.en:
Mwachupa is from Tiribe, Kenya. He makes a living buying and selling women's, men's and children's clothing. He is married.  His wife is a housewife and takes care of their four children. Mwachupa and his wife live together in their own house along with the children. He is a very hardworking man with very good references. 

Mwachupa is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing.  He wants to offer a better variety of clothing to his customers. He is very grateful for this opportunity and notes that it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 23-year-old conservative married lady, so she asked her husband, for whom she is taking this loan, to appear in the photo instead.

Aya's husband works and studies at the same time. He wants to get his degree so he can find better jobs in the future. 

Aya is applying for this educational loan to help her husband in paying for his upcoming semester fees and to support him in his studies, so they can properly raise their baby.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's semester fees.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Felicidad is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock for her business.

Felicidad has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felicidad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Nedaa

texts.en:
Nedaa is a 21-year-old conservative single lady, so she asked her one year younger sister, Rawan, to take her place in the photo.

Both Nedaa and Rawan go to college to study, but Nedaa is the one who also works and has a separate income. For that, Nedaa decided to take this loan to help her family and for her and her sister's semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her and her sister's semester fees.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more clothes and shirts for children, men and women. She has been in this business for ten years now, and it keeps on growing. She and her husband, who is a technician, work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 20,000 PHP, to buy more stock of clothes for children, men and women. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Virginia dreams of expanding her business and having more stalls. She hopes to have good health and a good life for her family. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise, like children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.
