He want to improve this new business.  He needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy calves.  He fattens the calves for resale.  Anar has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli city.  Now he lives in Fuzuli region with his family.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Light Group

texts.en:
Light is a group of eleven farmers from the Kakamega South District represented by John. The group has seven women and four men. John can be seen on the right side of the photo, raising his hand.

Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. John joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. He joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and access the good farming techniques training from One Acre Fund.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest ½ a bag of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund, he was able to harvest 4 bags per ½ acre. 

He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future.

John’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, the group will receive inputs for 5.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ahmad Bilal

texts.en:
Ahmad Bilal is a 57-year-old married man and the father of one child.  He has been selling shoes for 40 years.  In 2005, he started his own business to better improve his living and his family’s social and financial situation.  

Ahmad Bilal is well known in his region because of his long experience in his domain.  Ahmad Bilal is applying for his fifth cycle loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because he is planning to increase his business capital with new spring/summer collection to better serve his customers.  He hopes to be capable of expanding his business more and more.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with new spring/summer collection to better serve his customers

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is 35 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market in Montserrado County.  She is single and has four children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old.  

For the past three years she been operating a cook shop (Restaurant) in her community.  She likes the response to her business and she is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper and meat for her business.  Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper and meat for her business,

loans.name: Kasenyi United New Group

texts.en:
Euginio who is a single mother of 6 children lives near the landing site.  After separating from her husband she had to look for a means of survival to support her six children.  Without any capital, she opted to go to the landing site, where she  could access fish from the fishermen on credit and then pay after selling them. 

When she learnt of the Ugafode group from a friend at the same site she found it was wise to join since she would be able to get more fish with the loan money and therefore increase her sales.  She is grateful that UGAFODE Micro finance has made a difference in her life and that of her children.  She is hard working and determined to improve her life and that of her children despite her status as a single mother.  The client interviewed is the lady in a blue dress.

loans.use: To buy fish for sell

loans.name: Sekwat

texts.en:
Sekwat's previous loan allowed him to increase his working capital, buy more clothes for resale and pay a part of his children's school fees. 

He is now requesting a new loan to boost his business and open more branches. He is very happy for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more items for resale, such as women's dresses

loans.name: Mai-Me-S

texts.en:
Mai-Me-S is 41 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County.  She is single and living with her partner.  The two of them hve four children between the ages of 10 to 15 years old, that live at home with them and attend school. 

For nine years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market.  Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients by wholesale and has to buy retail which is much more expensive.  She likes the interaction with her customers and she learned how to cook from her mother a long time ago.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business.  In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, fish, chicken foot, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is from Kisauni, Mombasa.  She is single and has two children.  She is the owner of a store that sells various types of clothing from door to door, where she has worked with her mother for more than five years.

She is a very hard-working person, who, thanks to her efforts is getting ahead and helping her family day by day.  She tells us that things are very difficult, but in spite of that she makes an effort to move forward.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase clothing of all types to supply her business and in this way to be able to continue working and having sales that will give her the income to maintain her home.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Youssef Group

texts.en:
Layal is the featured borrower of Youssef’s Group.  She, along with her other group members are applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.  Layal is a 24-year-old married woman, mother of two children (Ali-6-M, Mohamad-5-M) who has been working in selling beauty cosmetics and creams for one year to help her husband in making their living and increasing their income. 

Layal is a hard worker who puts so much effort into helping her husband in improving their social and financial situation.  She is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Mjamoua, in order to buy new release spring/summer beauty cosmetics and creams to serve her customers better and to respond to their requests.  She hopes that one day she will be capable of opening her own shop instead of working from home.  Layal is the one in the middle.

Aliyeh is the one on the right; she is a 29-year-old married woman, mother of three children (Darine-13-F, Mohamad-11-M, Hamza-6-M).  She has been working in a school for five months, and is planning to invest the applied for loan to buy a new oven for her house instead of putting more pressure on her husband to increase his financial requests.

Huda is a 29-year-old married woman, mother of one child (Youssef-2.5 years-M),  She is the one from the left. She has been working as a hair dresser and a tutor for three years, to increase her family’s income and improve their standard of living.  Huda works at home and that’s why with the requested loan she will make sure that she will better serve her customers and improve her family’s living place through making the necessary maintenance and walls paintings.

loans.use: to buy new release for spring/summer beauty cosmetics and creams to serve her customers better and respond to their requests

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a businesswoman from Kisauni, Mombasa. She buys and sells essential goods and various items, and has a general store with a large clientele. Josephine is married and lives in her own home with her two children.

Josephine has very good references, and over 3 years experience in her field of work. She is well known for being very helpful and friendly.

She is requesting this loan to purchase basic supplies for her store, such as beverages, vegetables, meats, bread and other items, in order to keep offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store, such as beverages, vegetables, meats, bread

loans.name: Dúo Nueva Vicion Group

texts.es: Dúo Nueva Vicion, este dúo esta integrado por la señora Marlena, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica desde hace varios años, se siente muy contenta ya que por medio de su negocio se a superado de poco en poco, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en ropa tipica para la venta, espera que por medio de ustedes otorgandole el credito ella pueda seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Marlena is a member of "Dúo Nueva Vicion" (New Vision Duo).  She has been selling traditional clothing for a number of years and is very happy because, thanks to her business, she has gradually been able to survive.  She is applying for this loan to buy more merchandise (traditional clothing) to sell.  She hopes that, with the loan that you grant her, she will be able to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell
